intro: Coelocaryon klainei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-30 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soil and indirect sunlight. Coelocaryon klainei is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its adaptability and aesthetic appeal.
